headline.main: Edward Everett in Virginia--His Speeches at the Crawford Inauguration.

docs.abstract: Sp. at Richmond at inaug. of Wash. Stat
docs.lead_paragraph: Upon receiving the cane of WASHINGTON, which was presented to him at Richmond, Mr. EVERETT thus returned his acknowledgments: " SIR: I want words adequately to express the emotions of satisfaction and gratitude with which I receive this most interesting personal relic of the ' Father of his Country'-invaluable in itself, and rendered, if possible, still more precious, by the circumstances under which it comes into my possession.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; The Tariff Investigation--New-York Politics--Documents Relative to the Utah Expedition--Passage of the Indian Appropriation Bill in the House, &c. FROM WASHINGTON. By Telegraph to the New-York Times. Magantic Telegraphic Co.'s Offices--No. 45 Wall-st, and 181 Broadway

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. GREELEY is here to testify before the Tar?? Committee of Investigation. He will deny that he every had any conversation with MATTESON, or authorized any one to deposit money in his hands, to effect the passage of the Tariff modification. Judge RUSSELL and Postmaster FOWLER are here, operating against Collector SCHELL. Some ?? screw is loose.

headline.main: The Official Battle-Axe in Motion--The Bones of the Democratic Martyrs.

docs.lead_paragraph: From Yesterday's Washington Union. TREASON TO DEMOCRACY CONFIRMS ITS POWER, That vanlting ambition Which "o' erlcape itself and falls on 'toiner Side" never yet in so short a space of time worked such havoc with hopes, prospects and pretensions of presidential aspirants, as it has done since the last autumal frosts stripped the leaves from the forest. The grave- digger is abroad in the land.

headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS--- ---First Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MASON presented resolutions asking information as to the condition of the Navy for many Years past; also, relative to captures of vessels and prize money during the last war. Mr. CRITTENDEN presented a letter from Mr. SHELDS. and moved that he take his seat as Senator from Minnesota. The letter argues that Minnesota Is a sovereign State,

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM UTAH.; Brigham Young, Heber, Kimball and other Indicated for High Treason.

docs.lead_paragraph: E. G. BROWNE, the Utah correspondent of the New-York Tribune, arrived here last night, in company with U. S. Attorney HOCKADAY. They left Camp Scott on January 5. The health of the army continued good, and the weather was remarkably mild for the region. Very little snow had fallen, and In the immediate vicinity of the camp the ground was almost bare.

docs.snippet: That famous locally known as Jackson's Hollow, situated in the Seventh Ward, Brookly, is a strip of low land extending from Flushing-avenue southward to DeKalb-avenue, and bounded by Classon-avenue on the east, and Ryerson-street on the west. This,...

headline.main: HOMES OF THE POOR.; Jackson's Hollow and the People who Live in it.

docs.lead_paragraph: That famous locally known as Jackson's Hollow, situated in the Seventh Ward, Brookly, is a strip of low land extending from Flushing-avenue southward to DeKalb-avenue, and bounded by Classon-avenue on the east, and Ryerson-street on the west. This, however, is not the extent of the peculiar settlement which has sprung up there, for the "city of shanties" extends over the whole length of what was the old Jackson farm, across Fulton-avenue.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; ADVANCE IN COTTON--BREADSTUFFS DULL. DECLINE IN CONSOLS. The Anglo-French Alliance in Danger. Arrival of the Arago at this port and the Anglo-Saxon at Portland. REVOLUTIONARY MOVEMENTS IN SPAIN. Lord Palmerston's Conspiracy Bill Before Parliament. THE BOMBARDMENT OF CANTON. The English and French Forces Inside the City. IMPORTANT FROM INDIA. THE REFUGEE QUESTION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Arago, from Havre and Southampton, Feb. 10, arrived early this morning with four days' later news. Among her passengers are JOSIAH PIERCE, Esq., Secretary of Legation at St. Petersburg, and ELISHA RIGGS, Esq., Bearer of Despatches. The Arago brings a large number of passengers for the season, and her passage is the shortest that any steamer has made during the Winter.
